sentences.en: He can't be bought, ie is too honest to accept a bribe.
He gained entry into the building by means of a bribe to the guard.
sentences.cn: 他通过贿赂卫兵而获准进入大楼.
他坚决不接受他们的贿赂.

sentences.en: He tried to bribe the policeman not to arrest him.
sentences.cn: 他企图贿赂警察不逮捕他.

sentences.en: I have never before been asked to accept a bribe.
sentences.cn: 我以前从未被要求接受贿赂.

sentences.en: I wouldn't sully my hands by acceptinga bribe.
sentences.cn: 我决不接受贿赂,一尘不染.

sentences.en: Never before have I been asked to accept a bribe.
sentences.cn: 以前我从未被要求接受贿赂.

sentences.en: Of course Rahm cannot acknowledge that the bribe has worked.
sentences.cn: 当然,拉姆不能承认贿赂起了作用.

sentences.en: The children were given candy as a bribe to be good.
sentences.cn: 用糖果哄孩子们不要闹.

sentences.en: The idea of accepting a bribe was repugnant to me.
sentences.cn: 我一想到受贿这种事就非常反感.

sentences.en: The judge rejected a bribe from the defendant's family.
sentences.cn: 法官拒收被告家属的贿赂.

sentences.en: The judge was impeached for taking a bribe.
sentences.cn: 这个法官被检举接受贿赂.

sentences.en: The merchant offers a bribe to him.
The official was impeached for taking a bribe.
The officials said that they had been offered bribes before an important game.
sentences.cn: 这几名官员说，有人在一场重要比赛之前向他们行贿。

sentences.en: The only way we could get into the country was by bribing the border officials.
sentences.cn: 我们要进入这个国家，唯一的办法是贿赂边境官员。

sentences.en: There was a big stink about his accepting a bribe.
sentences.cn: 他收受贿赂,引起一场大纠纷.

trans.tran_en: money or a gift that you illegally give someone to persuade them to do something for you
to illegally give someone, especially a public official, money or a gift in order to persuade them to do something for you
